name: Team 20 - Catapulte tes Morts-Vivants
description:
A PC game designed for the Nintendo DS (2004) by 9 students from the IIM Digital School in Paris la Défense.

"Catapulte tes Morts-Vivants" is a shooting gallery type game where you throw zombies at people to make them eat brains.

Zombies have specifics needs and want a specific type of humans. If you don’t satisfy a zombie (waiting too long or not eating the right brain), they will turn back on you and make you lose a life.

The game is played on 2 screens. On the bottom screen zombies appear and you have to throw them toward the upper screen in the objective of making them hit humans that go left and right.

  • Interact with the slingshot on the bottom screen to throw zombies towards the upper screen.
  • Click on the slingshot with your mouse / stylus and drag it down to control the power of your shot.
  • Move your mouse / stylus left and right to adjust the direction of your shot
  • Finally, release your mouse / stylus to throw your zombie, easy-peasy!
TINAH · Catapulte tes Morts !

Game Producer :
- Tinah Ranarison

Game Designers :
- Adrien Henriot
- Silouane Parent
- Gaëtan Perré

Game Programmers :
- Dov Benzaquen
- Santino Romero
- Alhomsi Bruno Karim

Game artists :
- Maelys Daubié
- Theo Balicour
